byline.contributor: Declan Walsh contributed reporting from Cairo, Karam Shoumali from Istanbul, and Hwaida Saad from Beirut.

abstract: Maternity hospital in government-held part of Aleppo, Syria, is hit by insurgent shelling, marking sixth assault on medical facility in under week and first in areas under government control; attack kills at least three women and injures 17; rights groups condemn wave of attacks on hospitals as showing disregard for rules of war.

headline.print_headline: Another Hospital Is Hit in Latest Aleppo Violence
headline.main: Another Aleppo Hospital Is Hit, This Time on Government-Held Side

snippet: The attack on a maternity hospital, which killed at least three women, was the sixth assault on a medical facility in the divided Syrian city in less than a week.
lead_paragraph: The attack on a maternity hospital, which killed at least three women, was the sixth assault on a medical facility in the divided Syrian city in less than a week.
